fields.description:
I have custom domain for my repos. Embed link shows wrong src url.\\
For custom domain code.avrnoob.com and repo "litmer" it shows:

<script src="http://bitbucket.org/litmer/src/6b88e9b1992d/main.c?embed=t"></script> which is broken.It should show <script src="http://code.avrnoob.com/litmer/src/6b88e9b1992d/main.c?embed=t"></script> or <script src="http://bitbucket.org/antonveretenenko/litmer/src/6b88e9b1992d/main.c?embed=t"></script>
fields.summary: Wrong embed script src url for custom domain (BB-1083)

fields.description:
Ada programming language option is missing from the language list at Admin / Administration / Language setting.

I have a lot of Ada code repositories at http://bitbucket.org/tkoskine/ and I would like to mark them as Ada projects.

In addition, Ada is at position 16 in Tiobe index ( http://www.tiobe.com/index.php/content/paperinfo/tpci/index.html ), so it is pretty popular these days.
fields.summary: Ada option missing from the language list

fields.description:
I just deleted my bitbucket account to get rid of old entries from non-existing repositories, and re-created it with the same username/email address. After logging in with the newly created account, I still see the old entries on the public newsfeed. However, the account details on the account site are deleted (just how they should be).

If that behaviour is wanted, I would like to see a "clear public newsfeed" feature.
fields.summary: Public newsfeed persist even after deleting account (BB-1082)
Edit first an last name after registration

fields.description:
LabVIEW is a general purpose visual programming language, produced by National Instruments (ni.com/labview), and currently missing from the language list on bitbucket.\\
Please add this.

Ton
fields.summary: Add LabVIEW as language option

fields.description:
Updating the account settings (e.g. First Name, Last Name) results in the following error message:

{{{\\
This email address is already in use. Please supply a different email address.\\
}}}

This happens even though the email address wasn't changed.

==== How to reproduce ====

* Go to "Account" (https://bitbucket.org/account/)
* Edit the text in the "First Name" field
* Click "Save settings"
fields.summary: Saving account settings shows invalid error message

fields.description:
It's greate that bitbucket let us be able to use our own custom hostname to access Bitbucket. But I found a bug in the log on process.

reproduce:

* visit a custom hostname (or mine. hg.splayer.org) as a user that havn't log on bitbucket.
* click "Log on", submit username and password as it should.
* there is no error or warning and everything seems to be ok, the redirect me back.
* site still showing me as havn't log on

other fact:\\
once loged on at bitbucket.org. site with custom hostname show me as a loged on user normally.
fields.summary: couldn't log on under custom hostname

fields.description: I just registered at bitbucket and tried to set my first name etc in account settings. When I click on "Save settings" I get "This email address is already in use. Please supply a different email address." error. I've used this email during registration. Do I have to use new email every time I want to change account settings? :) And page shows ok message in green "Your profile settings have been saved.". But profile never saved. Just location field saved.
fields.summary: Can not save Account settings (Name etc) because email in use error

fields.description:
I have a few users that refuse to understand the importance of checkins that contain a message. If the checkin does not contain a message, there is no hot link to view the changes from the repo page (ie https://bitbucket.org/username/reponame).

The PITA work around is to view the atom feed and then click on one of the changed files of that change set.
fields.summary: No way to view changeset with no message (BB-1081)

fields.description: From rev494 OPL not work on my PS2.
fields.summary: rev494

fields.description: I am unable to click on the create repository link in the repositories menu using internet explorer 8.  The menu hides before I am able to hover over the menu.  Yes, I have chrome and firefox, but I use IE by default and it would be nice to use the basic functionality of the site in the lastest version of IE.
fields.summary: repository menu is unusable in Internet Explorer 8

fields.description:
I forked several projects from another account, and then deleted the original account. The forked repositories appear to have been deleted under the new account. Web UI gives back a 404, as does hg command line when trying to work with the forked repo. I expected a fork to be able to live on after the original repo was deleted - that's why I forked it in the first place.

Can I get these repos back?
fields.summary: Deleting parent of a fork makes fork unreachable (BB-564)

fields.description:
The email service stopped working sometime in the last few days. We've stopped receiving email notifications when somebody pushes to our repo.

This doesn't seem to be related to the repo itself (it's affecting multiple repositories). If it makes a difference, these are the repos we're using; the 'email service' is not working for either of them:

http://bitbucket.org/groves/monsterschool\\
http://bitbucket.org/tconkling/imp

I checked my Spam box to see if the emails were mistakenly being routed there, but they're not.
fields.summary: Email broker has stopped working

fields.description:
In comments u have 2 links

* <page>/#disqus_thread
* <page>/#comments

First link dosn't work, i only hidden this links, but don't load comments

* u have 2 img at comment url (see attached img)
fields.summary: [blog] incorrect comments link

fields.description:
Hi,

Currently, Sphinx appears to be gaining traction within the Python world as the standard for documentation, particularly in Django projects.

Github appears to correctly parse .rst files in repositories, and render them as HTML. E.g.:

https://github.com/dcramer/django-sentry/blob/master/docs/index.rst

It seems a bit embarrassing that BitBucket, which is based off Mercurial and meant to be Python-oriented, can't even get this right. E.g.:

http://bitbucket.org/ned/coveragepy/src/ad548b94dda6/doc/index.rst

Github has better Python support that us? That's so not cool...lol. Would be awesome if this could be fixed.

Cheers,\\
Victor
fields.summary: Parse/Render RestructuredText/Markdown/Textile files as HTML (BB-1080)

fields.description:
I have two identities - a personal one (default) I use for my projects and a second work one for work projects.

I accidentally made a commit to a work repository without setting .hg/hgrc so my personal email address ended up being associated with the commit.

This commit only shows up in the shortlog on the bb website.  It is not present on the dashboard or RSS/Atom feeds for the project.

All commits no matter who made them and what permissions happen to be associated with the committer email address should show up in the feeds for a repository.
fields.summary: Not all commits show up in dashboards/feeds of private repository

fields.description:
I have two files in download section: A and B. Then I've tried upload the new version of A I get three files: A, B and AA. I can't delete AA.

Repo name's jedit-markdown-plugin.
fields.summary: Can't delete download item

fields.description:
Hi there.

I have this repository...

ssh://hg@bitbucket.org/nevdelap/junk

...which is just a bogus repo for testing setting up continuous integration, and if you look at it you'll see it is just lots of bogus commits for that purpose.

It is set up with a POST to http://salt.intelestream.net/trigger_update.php when the repo changes and that works just great.

The real repository for which this continuous integration stuff that I'm doing is intended is this one...

ssh://hg@bitbucket.org/digimagic/salt

It is set up to post to the same url. But that hasn't worked. I've also set up an Email service on that one. I've not got it to post or email me anything when it is pushed to.

A difference between these is that my account was a paid account until Atlassian took over. Maybe that gave me something extra. digimagic (Jason's) isn't a paid account.

I also deleted the POST service and had Jason add it, in case that made a difference. It didn't, but I am admin on both so that was just a stab in the dark.

I was pushing to the test repo and real repo using my account, 'nevdelap'.

Aside from that I can't think of what would be different between the two.

Thanks in advance,

Nev
fields.summary: POST working fine on one repo, not on another. (BB-1024)

fields.description: If you look at http://clojurewise.blogspot.com/2010/11/digest-clojure-library-for-digest.html line 27 have \, this should be . (see https://bitbucket.org/tebeka/clj-digest/src/tip/src/digest.clj line 27)
fields.summary: Bad HTML escaping in embedded links (BB-1023)

fields.description:
I'm following a development model where I create a new branch for each new feature, and then close the branch once the changes have been commited to the main branch. This means I am building up lots of closed (dead) branches.

The hg command line tools like "hg branches" hide closed branches by default, which is good.

The bitbucket page does not, and I think it should.
fields.summary: Closed branches shown for repositories

fields.description: When I look at my commit msg in http://hg.meego.com/mobile-browser/changeset/7a06c3e5d755 bitbucket tries to highlight the changesets that I refer to. However, the URLs are invalid as they have an extra "MeeGoAdmin" in their path.
fields.summary: Highlighted changeset links for commit msg generate invalid URL (BB-685)

fields.description:
*Steps to reproduce:*

h1. Go to http://bitbucket.org/chris1610/satchmo/issue/838/product-inheritence-causes-infinite
h1. Try to view either of the diffs attached to it; e.g. http://media-static.bitbucket.org//attch/2009/07/inheritence.diff
h1. Server returns an error: "There's no hosted repository for media-static.bitbucket.org."
fields.summary: Update comments in db to reflect new attachment URLs, was: Attachments not accessible, media-static.bitbucket.org broken (BB-1022)

fields.description:
I can honestly say, I've never had a harder time getting a piece of code from one place to another!

# First I downloaded Mercurial and right after installation 'hg' gave me:\\
"The system cannot execute the specified program"\\
But, I figured that's not your fault, apparently Mercurial/Python must suck.
# Next I decided I'd check it out with SVN, and I didn't have much more luck.  After a couple of errors saying that remote folders didn't exist and a painfully slow download I received the following error from svn which terminated the checkout:\\
RA layer request failed\\
svn: REPORT of '/frostwire/frostwire/!svn/vcc/default': Compressed response was truncated (http://bitbucket.org)
# Finally, I thought I would just try to download the code through the "get source" link on the page of the project itself.  Well it turns out that all three compressed files are corrupted: zip, gz, and bgz.

This is crazy!
fields.summary: Can source code from your site be downloaded?
ERRO ADRIANA

fields.description:
For client side issue mail filtering it would be really usefull, if you add some "X-Bitbucket-*" mail headers to issue mails like *Bugzilla* and *SourceForge* do:

* X-Bitbucket-Username: kimmov
* X-Bitbucket-Repository: winmerge-web
* X-Bitbucket-Issue-Id: 6
* X-Bitbucket-Status: open
* X-Bitbucket-Responsible: nobody
* X-Bitbucket-Type: bug
* X-Bitbucket-Milestone: none
* X-Bitbucket-Component: none
* X-Bitbucket-Version: none

Greetings,\\
Tim Gerundt

=== Bugzilla ===

* X-Bugzilla-Reason: CC
* X-Bugzilla-Type: changed
* X-Bugzilla-Watch-Reason: QAcontact places@firefox.bugs
* X-Bugzilla-Who: gerv@mozilla.org
* X-Bugzilla-Changed-Fields: AssignedTo Status
* X-Bugzilla-URL: https://bugzilla.mozilla.org/
* X-Bugzilla-Classification: Client Software
* X-Bugzilla-Product: Firefox
* X-Bugzilla-Component: Places
* X-Bugzilla-Keywords: crash, regression
* X-Bugzilla-Severity: major
* X-Bugzilla-Status: NEW
* X-Bugzilla-Priority: P2
* X-Bugzilla-Assigned-To: mconnor@mozilla.com
* X-Bugzilla-Target-Milestone: Firefox 3.6

http://bugzillatips.wordpress.com/2010/02/05/client-side-bugmail-filtering/

=== SourceForge ===

* X-SourceForge-Tracker-unixname: winmerge
* X-SourceForge-Tracker-trackerid: 313216
* X-SourceForge-Tracker-itemid: 3114642
* X-SourceForge-Tracker-itemstatus: Closed
* X-SourceForge-Tracker-itemassignee: nobody
* X-SourceForge-Tracker-itemupdate-reason: Settings changed
* X-SourceForge-Tracker-itemupdate-username: gerundt
fields.summary: Add X-Bitbucket-* mail headers to issue mails (BB-1021)
Events API delete event returns null repository name (BB-50)
Events API returns events w/o auth for private repositories (BB-50)
Events API start and limit allows to query only 1st 50 events (BB-50)
Events API doesn't include private repository activity (BB-50)

fields.description:
When I click inside the comment input text field, it minimizes always after I dragged it larger and I can't read my complete text anymore. It doesn't scroll correctly to the cursor position and the cursor can go out of view.

It's currently not possible to scroll properly up/down inside this field. I'm missing a vertical scroll bar.

The width of the field only uses 1/2 ("Create new") and 2/3 ("Add comment") of your layout width, which still is only 1/2 of my screen width.\\
I would prefer a field nearly as wide as my screen.
fields.summary: Add comment, text field strange behaviour (BB-1020)

fields.description:
A nice enhancement might be the ability to set a default content for issue reporting. This will add the ability to tell people what info you want about the bug.

Example:

What steps will reproduce the problem?

What is the expected output? What do you see instead?

What version of the product are you using? On what operating system?

Please provide any additional information below.
fields.summary: Ability to add a default issue content (BB-658)

fields.description:
Hi,

I think it would be nice if there was a tab in the repositories column to switch and view other's repositories instead of having them just in the dropdown menu.

The reason I'm suggesting this is because my dropdown menu has become to boog and I need to scroll the page down to get to see it, and it is annoying.

Regards,

David
fields.summary: A better way to organize other's repositories (BB-353)

fields.description:
The basic steps I took...

h1. Create an user account, "someaccount"
h1. Create a private repository named "alpha" on "someaccount"
h1. Create a new user account, "anotheraccount"
h1. Create a private repository named "alpha" on "anotheraccount"
h1. Add "someaccount" as a writer to "alpha" on "anotheraccount"
h1. Delete the repository named "alpha" on "someaccount"
h1. From "someaccount", visit "alpha" on "anotheraccount"
h1. Click the 'Follow' heart icon link near the top of the page for that "alpha" repository.
h1. Click on Dashboard (signed in on "someaccount")
At this point, in the 'Following' section on the dashboard for "someaccount", I can see a repository that I am following.  It is listing and pointing to my deleted repository: "alpha" on "someaccount", which no longer exists.

I believe this is a bug, for I am clicking 'Follow' for the "alpha" repository on "anotheraccount".  I would expect their repository to be displayed in the 'Following' section, rather than the repository I deleted.
fields.summary: Following Repository With Same Name Points Incorrectly (BB-1018)

fields.description:
On successful completion of a repository I seem to have been delivered just the headers of the success page. This is what appeared in my browser (though I've replaced certain parts of it with xxxx for any possible security implications)...

HTTP/1.1 302 FOUNDServer: nginx/0.7.67\\
Date: Thu, 18 Nov 2010 09:05:04 GMT\\
Content-Type: text/html; charset=utf-8\\
Connection: close\\
Content-Length: 0\\
Expires: Thu, 18 Nov 2010 09:05:04 GMT\\
Vary: Cookie\\

fields.summary: Possibly malformed headers on successful repo creation

fields.description:
The CSS used for Bitbucket's site has a tendency to impact rendered ReST files when the section headers in the ReST happen to match up with selectors used in Bitbucket's design.

An example can be see at https://bitbucket.org/jayclassless/memcacheinspector/src where the "Introduction" section of the rendered README.rst has a dark blue background (today, at least; a week or two ago, the background was white, but so was the text).
fields.summary: Bitbucket Site CSS Impacts Rendered ReST (BB-492)

fields.description:
When setting up the CIA.vc service, CIA.vc seems to ignore or never gets the change information after the first push.

So basically, setup a project on CIA.vc (let's say foo, hypothetically).\\
Setup foo and all.\\
Go into bitbucket and create a new repository.\\
Setup the CIA.vc service to use foo as both module and project or just project.\\
$ hg clone repourl\\
$ hg add test\\
$ hg commit -m "Test"\\
$ hg push

CIA then recieves the message (shows in the project stats). However if we again did:

$ hg add test2\\
$ hg commit -m "Test 2"\\
$ hg push

CIA never gets anything.
fields.summary: CIA.vc doesn't show messages after first push. (BB-1016)

fields.description:
Hi! Great extension! :) I have a small issue though: I find that when adding an xlink to an object created by textext, the resulting link can be hard to click on (in firefox).

I have an example (temporarily) here:

http://golux.podzone.net/misc

By comparison, the link associated with the seemingly much smaller "A distant galaxy...." text is easy to click on. I realise this may not be textext's fault or even a 'real' problem at all but I'm not expert enough with inkscape/svg to know if this is something I could (easily) work around.
fields.summary: Adding xlinks to the textext object.

the link for "Visit your dashboard" is 'https://bitbucket.org/}'

clicking 404s
fields.summary: Link to dashboard from welcome page is broken

fields.description:
If you visit this URL in google chrome:\\
If you visit this link in google chrome:

http://bitbucket.org/caseman/planar/changeset/f0eae5328edd#chg-lib/planar/cpolygon.c_newline123

You will notice cent signs inserted inline where they should not be. I reported this as a google chrome bug, but apparently it is behaving correctly according to their interpretation of the html5 spec wrt entities. See the bug report and their response here:

http://code.google.com/p/chromium/issues/detail?id=60677

Since it is currently rendered incorrectly in chrome and will probably render incorrectly in other html5 compliant browsers, I think you will need to escape ampersands in source listings as &
fields.summary: Ampersands in source listings rendered incorrectly in html5 enabled browsers

fields.description:
Frequently, when I try to hg pull or hg push on one of my repositories, I get the following error message:

abort: '[repo-url]' does not appear to be an hg repository!

The only way I seem to be able to resolve it is to hop into my browser and go to the URL in question.  At this point, I will get a progress bar and it will tell me that my repo is being created. Once complete, the repo will be available again with my full history and everything.  I would say this probably happens almost every day on my first commit, though occasionally it won't.

I haven't noticed it happening on my other repos, but I don't push or pull them as frequently, so that may be why.  If it is unique to this repo, it may be because the name of the repo is 'config'.  I have also noticed that on at least one occasion, the link from my dashboard pointed at '.config' rather than 'config', and I had to manually enter the URL to get the repo to recreate.

I searched for this issue before reporting it, and found at least one more that might be related (#1841), but was marked as resolved.  I wasn't sure if I should tag onto that one, so I made a new issue and you guys can link or mark as duplicate as appropriate.

Thank you.
fields.summary: Repository intermittently becomes unavailable until I visit the page for it (BB-1015)

fields.description:
The django/django repos has a lot of branches. When browsing them on the website you can't use the bradcrumbs because you then always go back to the tip.

It would be very nice if the current displayed revision is used there instead of the tip revision so I can actually browse through old revisions/branches.
fields.summary: source breadcrumbs shouldn't link back to tip revision (BB-1014)

fields.description:
Hello,\\
When I update the web address for a repo on the Admin page, the header still shows the old address. I can delete it, that works, but after that writing a new address still brings back the old one. Is this a bug?\\
Cheers,\\
Attila
fields.summary: web address doesn't get updated for repo

fields.description:
Hi!

I can't delete a repos as it asks for a password but I am logged in via my google account :-/

I don't think I have to give my google account password right?

Thank you for your support!

Hadrien
fields.summary: Can't delete a repo

fields.description:
On the right sidebar of my profile page(http://bitbucket.org/robal/) you will see the emacs.d repository but I can't do anything with it. Could you please remove it? I wants new epmpty emacs.d repo:D!

PS. sorry for my english
fields.summary: repository is visible but without access

fields.description:
Hello,

I request an bug because i can't leave a repository.\\
https://bitbucket.org/Rakez/core-tbc
fields.summary: Cannot kick me

fields.description: Your Dashboard page has some bugs in it with relation to subject of periods "." and dashes "-".  See attachment which points out some of these bugs I noticed on my repos after playing around with the names for them via renaming using Admin tab and flipping back thru the other tabs for about 10 min.
fields.summary: Dashboard gets confused after renaming repo repeatedly with "-" and/or "."

fields.description: When looking through the diff menu of a file, I noticed the revisions were sorted lexically rather than descending by revision number...I've attached an image to highlight the issue.
fields.summary: Source File Diff Menu -> Lexically Sorted instead of Numerically

fields.description: Systeem kapot
fields.summary: Het werkt niet

fields.description:
I'm not sure it is a correct place to ask.\\
But why user login can not contain dots?\\
Ex.: j.smith, l.torvalds, s.jobs, b.gates, so on.
fields.summary: Why dots are not allowed in login name

fields.description: It seems that is had stopped getting recent activity at some point.
fields.summary: My dashboard does not contain recent activity (BB-49)

fields.description:
Type in the search box: "Glen". The drop down list does not appear.\\
When you press " Go" button the site is able to take this search term and it sets the apartment to the Glen which is not a wrong behavior. However the search box should show a dropdown list matching the typed word on the name of the apartment complex.  We should sort the list with the names of the apartment complexes first. And then it should match on city. And then on the state text (if we have that state full name in the database)
fields.summary: The dropdown list to match the typed word does not appear

fields.description:
For djangopackages.com we want to list all the people who have collaborated on a project - in other words submitted code that has gotten into master and into PyPI releases. However, bitbucket doesn't provide that unless I continually check the commit list. Unfortunately bitbucket only provides the last 50 commits, so some users will be missed using this approach - perhaps early and important committers.

Could bitbucket provide a list of collaborators on a project?
fields.summary: No way to get collaborators via the API (BB-50)

fields.description:
In the repository admin section, if I add a user to the writers list, I was half expecting that user to also become a follower of the repository.

This behavior makes sense to me, as a developer, because if I've been given write permissions to a repository, I also want to follow what's happening with the repository.

I do see that the repository shows up on my Repositories menu in the header, in the "Other Repositories" section, so I could visit that repository and follow it manually, but if this happened automatically for me that would be great.
fields.summary: Adding a new writer should add them to follower's list (in my opinion)

fields.description:
The comment box on the issue tracker doesn't have a scroll bar down the side while editing. It gets painful with long edits.

Also it would be nice if the "Show/hide preview" box showed carriage returns (and the layout) a little better.
fields.summary: comment box on issue tracker (BB-993)
RSS/Atom feed does not include issue updates details (BB-684)

fields.description:
When browsing to my private repository before logging in, I get a page with the following content:

== Error \\\
You do not have access to this repository

I suggest it would be much nicer if I got a login page which on successful authentication would redirect me to the repository of my interest.
fields.summary: Error You do not have access to this repository

fields.description: I tried to add basecamp integration to my repository at: http://bitbucket.org/grenade/openancestry, I believe the basecamp discussion URL (https://openancestry.basecamphq.com/projects/5696784/posts/37586323/comments) is valid. A similar approach worked for another repository where I have BC integration and Twitter seems to work but I don't get commit messages in Basecamp on the grenade/openancestry repo.
fields.summary: Bascamp service integration appears to not be working

fields.description: url links name in dashboard is not affected and still using old names. And first try of delete repository report crsf error(second try worked).
fields.summary: Changing name of Repository problem

fields.description: I'm just starting to use bitbucket.  Love the concept and love the impl.  I need to know if there is a way that I can create custom issue types for my project and delete some of the out of the box ones? Right now I'm using a free account but I'm willing to get a paid account to gain this functionality. Thank you for your attention on this matter.
fields.summary: Creating custom issue types (BB-1013)

fields.description:
When I got to my account page and click on the little arrow behind someone's name in the Private Users list I get a loading image and then nothing.

The repository listing is there, but it has a display: none.
fields.summary: Account's private user repository list doesn't show

fields.description:
You guys might want to paginate the followers (zealots) page…

An example: http://bitbucket.org/ellislab/codeigniter/zealots

650+ users loads quite slowly
fields.summary: Zealots has no pagination (BB-1011)

fields.description:
I've stumbled upon a very strange bug. When I type in bitbucket in Google, and click on the first link (http://bitbucket.org), I get a random profile instead of the homepage of the site (see screenshot). When I refresh the page the homepage is shown as intended. After the refresh, bitbucket02 becomes bitbucket03 in the footer. I figure this is the current instance as part of some kind of load balancing setup...

P.S. In my paragraph above, ')' is taken as a part of the url, which seems to be a small bug in the preview function of the issue tracker.
fields.summary: Website root of bitbucket.org sometimes shows random profile instead of homepage

fields.description:
It was working earlier; here is a link where the issue can be seen: https://bitbucket.org/dukeofgaming/mootools-furthermore/changesets

Regards
fields.summary: Gravatar not working (BB-1010)

fields.description:
It would be cool to be able to group own repositories in "Your repositories" sidebar. Open close groups and maybe simple Javascript based search by name and/or description.

I have lots of repositories and right now it gets harder and harder to find the repo I'm looking for between all of them.
fields.summary: Group own repositories (BB-1009)
API to get issue comments? (BB-1008)

fields.description:
Consider the following directory structure:\\
{{{\\
|-- BAZ\\
|   |-- Content\\
|        |-- foo.wiki\\
|        |-- bar.wiki\\
|   {{-- Main.wiki}}-- Home.wiki\\
}}}\\
\\\
In Main.wiki I have a toc:\\
{{{<<toc Content/>>}}}\\
which should display a toc for all the files in Content dir.\\
\\\
This doesn't work: *Wiki macro error: Either directory does not exist or no files found.*\\
\\\
So I changed it to:\\
{{{<<toc BAZ/Content/>>}}}\\
\\\
Which does give the correct content. But when I press the links, instead of going to ///wiki/BAZ/Content/foo// it goes to ///wiki/BAZ/*BAZ*/Content/foo//
fields.summary: Toc macro does not work in nested directories (BB-1007)

fields.description:
It looks like the commit message is not taking white space into consideration, thus don't displaying line breaks, for commit messages making it hard to read. for instance http://bitbucket.org/mirror/mercurial-crew/changeset/076bbbf0ba86 as opposed to http://mercurial.selenic.com/hg/crew/rev/076bbbf0ba86 setting white-space:pre for

that contains message fixes that.
fields.summary: Commit messages are displayed wrongly.

fields.description:
Hi Jesper,

Can you help me to be  able to commit to my repo again please? The name is http://bitbucket.org/adflickr/adflickr

Many thanks in advance,

Darren
fields.summary: Cannot push to repo - get HTTP Error 500: Internal Server Error

fields.description:
E.g. https://bitbucket.org/Manfre/xpattern works

https://bitbucket.org/manfre/xpattern results in "The page isn't redirecting properly". Firefox/4.0b5pre

The latter should probably result in a 404 page.
fields.summary: redirect loop when username with uppercase letters mistyped in url (BB-1006)

fields.description:
Hello,

We would like to subscribe to BitBucket but we would like to use OpenID for auth. We are using Google Apps Premier as our OpenID provider. I'm not finding any documentation on the requirements to make this work and when I select "Google" for my OpenID provider in the login prompt the redirect does not send me to a URL that will work for Google Apps.

Can you provide details on using OpenID + GAP + BitBucket.

I would sign up for an account on the support site so that I can track this request but I don't want to cause any conflicts between new account and future OpenID-based accounts.

Please contact nvalentine@fluid.com.

Thx.
fields.summary: OpenID w/ Google Apps as provider
private repositories not visible via bitbucket API (BB-797)

fields.description:
When hovering over a user's avatar, a menu is displayed containing three options: "View user's profile", "User's public repos" and "Send message".  Before the Altassian branding was applied to the site, the menu was displayed on the right of the avatar, and moving the mouse over to it was possible.

In the new branding, the menu is displayed below the avatar.  Attempting to use the menu by moving the mouse over to it results in the menu disappearing, presumably because the menu responds to a mouseout event fired by the avatar.  This makes the menu impossible to use.
fields.summary: Hovering over a user's avatar displays a menu that cannot be used

fields.description: It would be useful if repositories that have been moved elsewhere via their respective admin utils were not displayed on the user's repository list, or if this could at least be a configuration option. I have a bunch of repositories that were merged and have since updated the old repos to point to the new ones. This, of course, leads to a lot of repos listed on my homepage/repo list that aren't actually useful anymore.
fields.summary: Moved repository still showing on repository list (BB-1005)
Nested subrepositories (BB-1004)

fields.description:
If a repository uses subrepos, it would be nice if subrepos on Bitbucket would be recognized.

Perhaps one could even include the subrepo in the file browser: when you descend into a directory that is a subrepo, you will see the files in that subrepo.
fields.summary: Show subrepositories (BB-1003)

fields.description:
https://bitbucket.org/timeless/transifex/changeset/442da961f445

{{{\\
$ hg clone https://timeless@bitbucket.org/timeless/transifex\\
...\\
commit 2563: 	442da961f445\\
parent 2562: 	ac88e9c5e7d3\\
branch: 	default\\
Adding missing blank line at end of file\\
...\\
Changed (Δ1 byte):\\
raw changeset »

transifex/addons/locks/templates/lock_resource_action.html (binary file changed)

Up to file-list transifex/addons/locks/templates/lock_resource_action.html:

Binary file has changed or diff was empty.\\
}}}

==\\
== "Raw" output from bitbucket ==\\
https://bitbucket.org/timeless/transifex/changeset/442da961f445/raw/transifex-442da961f445.diff\\
{{{

h1. HG changeset patch -- Bitbucket.org
h1. Project transifex
h1. URL http://bitbucket.org/timeless/transifex/overview
h1. User timeless [timeless%40gmail.com]
h1. Date 1286268675 -10800
h1. Node ID 442da961f445af8977f1b5618634658cc5af7cef
h1. Parent  ac88e9c5e7d3af2c7b08f54f003049956234753d
h1. Adding missing blank line at end of file\\
}}}
== The changeset is not empty ==\\
Here is the export by hg (1.6.3):\\
{{{\\
timeless-mbp:mainline timeless$ hg export .

h1. HG changeset patch
h1. User timeless [timeless%40gmail.com]
h1. Date 1286268675 -10800
h1. Node ID 442da961f445af8977f1b5618634658cc5af7cef
h1. Parent  ac88e9c5e7d3af2c7b08f54f003049956234753d
Adding missing blank line at end of file

diff --git a/transifex/addons/locks/templates/lock_resource_action.html b/transifex/addons/locks/templates/lock_resource_action.html\\
--- a/transifex/addons/locks/templates/lock_resource_action.html\\
+++ b/transifex/addons/locks/templates/lock_resource_action.html\\
@@ -115,4 +115,4 @@

 </script>-{% endwith %}\\
\ No newline at end of file\\
+{% endwith %}\\
}}}
fields.summary: changeset viewer doesn't properly handle a changeset which only adds the blank line at the end of a file (BB-1002)

fields.description:
== Steps ==

h1. Visit http://bitbucket.org/indifex/transifex/fork
h1. name: "y"
h1. click advanced settings
h1. fork at: specific revision: 00000000
h1. I pushed the mainline repository from transifex into /y
h1. visit http://bitbucket.org/timeless/y/admin and rename it to transifex
== Expected results ==\\
All pages should properly list transifex (and none should list "y")

== Actual results ==\\
The main page [http://bitbucket.org/timeless] does not:\\
{{{\\
Repositories\\
y (created 59 seconds ago)

transifex-broken (created 3 months ago)\\
This repository is broken. Do not use it.

transifex-commonpool (created 2 months ago)\\
Spelling fixes\\
}}}

Clicking "y" takes me to the cloning page (presumably from when the initial clone was created).
fields.summary: account main page doesn't update properly after repository renames

fields.description:
Admin currently has strip which is dangerous.

There isn't an option for recover, which can be needed in certain cases (one of which is triggered by using strip).

There have been a couple of tickets filed here asking for recover to be run manually, but unless there's some special reason not to, it seems like recover should be a button people can push.
fields.summary: Please provide hg recover via the admin page (BB-1001)

fields.description:
{{{\\
timeless-mbp:mainline timeless$ hg push-to-bitbucket\\
pushing to ssh://hg@bitbucket.org/timeless/transifex-broken\\
searching for changes\\
remote: abort: abandoned transaction found - run hg recover!\\
abort: unexpected response: empty string\\
}}}

Please run hg recover. I renamed the repository because I need people to be able to pull from it, but I'd like to be able to have the original repository creation date and bits back.
fields.summary: transifex-broken repository broke after strip please run hg recover

fields.description: look at attachment image
fields.summary: incorrect date\time problem in newsfeed

fields.description:
After login, it redirects me to bitbucket.org, not hg.example.com.\\
When I'm returning to hg.example.com I'm not logged in.

Also, when after manual login my newsfeed is empty, but it may relate to http://bitbucket.org/jespern/bitbucket/issue/2146/neewsfeed-not-updating
fields.summary: cannot login with openid on custom domain (BB-837)

fields.description: Despite I unchecked corresponding checkbox for my new private repos, wiki system was created.
fields.summary: unwanted wiki is created for repos (BB-234)

fields.description:
The List element bullets/numbering does not show up as shown in the attached image.

The code of the page is at https://bitbucket.org/lethalinjectionx/trinity-core-patches/wiki/Home

The issue is caused by the following CSS style info present in reset.css at line 28 (https://bitbucket-assets.s3.amazonaws.com/css/reset.css)

ol, ul {\\
list-style:none outside none;\\
}
fields.summary: List Bullets/Numbering not shown

fields.description:
Hi there. Can you please make the bold style just be bold instead of changing the font?

#wiki b, #wiki strong {\\
font-family: Georgia, Times, "Times New Roman", serif;\\
}
fields.summary: bold/strong wiki styles are serifed. (BB-910)

fields.description:
[i have already reported this via email, opening an issue just in case.]

a very large private repository was uploaded. after the upload, the repository content can be accessed with clone, push etc. but the bitbucket admin controls are completely lost: "we are doing some maintenance. be right back"

we have also encountered this problem if a large push fails (eg. gateway timeout) to a fresh repository.

this is urgent.
fields.summary: large repository breaks admin interface, unmanageable (BB-909)

fields.description:
I'm lazy, so here's a copypaste: :)

22:21 < clb_> I wonder what's up with this? https://bitbucket.org/help/using-bitbucket\\
22:24 < hstuart> clb_, doesn't look too lovely :)\\
22:25 < clb_> link from here http://bitbucket.org/repo/create\\
22:25 < hstuart> probably better to alert the people in #bitbucket\\
22:25 < ronny> clb_: looks broken, the correct one i https://bitbucket.org/help/UsingBitbucket
fields.summary: Broken link on creating a repo page.

fields.description: The search form (id is "topsearch") at the top of the page only seems to appear when you are logged in to a bitbucket account. This makes it harder for new visitors to the website to search for repositories.
fields.summary: top search box does not appear unless signed in to an account
